description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
description.Credits: Total Credits: 3   Lecture/Recitation/Discussion Hours: 2   Lab Hours: 2
description.Prerequisite: (MTH 103 or MTH 103B or MTH 116 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H or LB 118 or LB 117) or designated score on Mathematics Placement test
description.Description: Fundamentals of computing, algorithms and programming, using a high-level language such as Python.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
description.Credits: Total Credits: 3   Lecture/Recitation/Discussion Hours: 2   Lab Hours: 2
description.Prerequisite: (EGR 100 or ECE 101) and ((MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently))
description.Restrictions: Open to undergraduate students.
description.Description: Basics of programming in C. Data types, operators, control, functions, arrays, pointers, file processing, testing and debugging.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
description.Credits: Total Credits: 4   Lecture/Recitation/Discussion Hours: 3   Lab Hours: 2
description.Prerequisite: (LB 118 or concurrently) or (MTH 124 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (MTH 152H or concurrently)
description.Description: Introduction to programming using Python. Design, implementation and testing of programs to solve problems such as those in engineering, mathematics and science. Programming fundamentals, functions, objects, and use of libraries of functions.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
description.Credits: Total Credits: 4   Lecture/Recitation/Discussion Hours: 3   Lab Hours: 2
description.Prerequisite: (CSE 231 or CMSE 202) and (LB 118 or MTH 124 or MTH 132 or MTH 152H)
description.Description: Continuation of object-centered design and implementation in C++. Building programs from modules. Data abstraction and classes to implement abstract data types. Static and dynamic memory allocation. Data structure implementation and algorithm efficiency. Lists, tables, stacks, and queues. Templates and generic programming.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
description.Prerequisite: MTH 133 or MTH 126 or MTH 153H or LB 119
description.Description: Propositional and first order logic. Equivalence and methods of proof. Basics of counting. Set operations, relations, functions. Grammars and finite state automata. Discrete probability. Applications to computer science and engineering.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 3 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Approval of department; application required.
description.Description: Supervised individual study in an area of computer science.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 8 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Approval of department.
description.Description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses and lead to the development of new courses.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
description.Restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the College of Engineering.

description.Description: Professional responsibilities and informed judgments in computing practice based on legal and ethical principles. Local and global impacts of computing solutions on individuals, organizations, and society.
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.

description.Description: Boolean algebra and digital logic. Combinational and sequential circuits. Representations of data and instructions. Architecture and major components of computer systems. Assembly language programming and interfacing to high level languages. Assembler and linker processing.
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

description.Restrictions: Open to students in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Process and processor management. Concurrent processes and threads. Memory management and the memory hierarchy. Networking and network protocols. Secure programming and communication methods.
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Data Science Major and open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering.
description.Description: Design, analysis, and application of fundamental algorithms and data structures in computer science.
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.
description.Description: Development of large software products, libraries, and product families. Object-oriented programming using inheritance and polymorphism. Design methods. Specification and the use of contracts to design reliable software. Configuration management and life-cycle issues.

description.Prerequisite: (CSE 331) and (STT 351 or STT 380 or STT 430 or STT 441) and MTH 314 and (MTH 234 or MTH 254H or LB 220)
description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Data Science Major.
description.Description: Automated techniques used for feature extraction and pattern matching focusing on face, fingerprint and iris recognition.

description.Prerequisite: (CSE 331) and (STT 351 or STT 380 or STT 430 or STT 441) and MTH 314
description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Data Science Major.
description.Description: Core principles and techniques for machine learning including algorithms, model design, and programming.
description.Interdepartmental With: Statistics and Probability, Computational Mathematics, Science, & Engineering

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Theory and application of modern computer operating systems.

description.Prerequisite: (CSE 320 or ECE 331) and (MTH 314 or ECE 280) and CSE 331
description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Data Science Major.

description.Description: Principles and techniques of parallel computing including architectures, programming models, and algorithm design.
description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.

description.Description: Fundamental organization and architecture of computer systems.
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
description.Prerequisite: (STT 351 or ECE 280 or STT 430 or STT 441) and CSE 325

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Computer network architectures and protocols.
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Theory and practice of computer security engineering.

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.
description.Description: Technical, legal, criminal, medical business, and communication aspects of CyberSecurity.

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Algorithm analysis, design, implementation, and optimization for a broad range of problem categories including techniques to recognize and cope with intractable problems.

description.Credits: Total Credits: 3   Lecture/Recitation/Discussion Hours: 2   Lab Hours: 2
description.Recommended Background: Proficiency in Python programming strongly recommended, equivalent to a one-semester Python class.
description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering.
description.Description: Overview of technologies vehicles including sensors, sensing algorithms, machine learning, localization, mapping, object detection, tracking, communication and security. Hands-on implementation of robotic sensing and navigation algorithms on both simulated and physical mobile platforms.

description.Prerequisite: (CSE 331 and CSE 335) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Software engineering methods for reliable, reusable, and dependable software.

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Data Science Major.
description.Description: Fundamental algorithms and methods in intelligent systems and artificial intelligence.

description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Information Technology Minor.
description.Description: Practical training and experiences in design, testing, and launch of new information technologies and systems.

description.Interdepartmental With: Information Technology Management, Media and Information

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Theory and practice of programming language translation from languages and grammars to optimization and generation.

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor.
description.Description: Formal models of computation such as finite state automata, pushdown automata and Turing machines. Formal definitions of languages, problems, and language classes including recursive, recursively enumerable, regular, and context free languages. The relationships among various models of computation, language classes, and problems. Church's thesis and the limits of computability. Proofs of program properties including correctness.

description.Prerequisite: (CSE 320 or CSE 331 or CSE 335) and (MTH 314 or ECE 280)
description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Theory and practice for manipulation of digital images, video, and audio in computer applications.

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Theory and practice for the generation of two- and three-dimensional imagery.

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Software development techniques for mobile devices such as smart phones and tablet computers.

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Fundamentals of World Wide Web (WWW) programming, including protocols, client-server interaction, markup languages, client- and server-side programming, databases, and remote procedure calls. Development of a WWW server and WWW sites with browser-based interfaces to remote databases. Students will incorporate scaling, throughput, and latency considerations in the development of widely-distributed systems.

description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Computer Science Minor or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Data Science Major.
description.Description: Principles and technologies for database systems, algorithms, languages, and applications.

description.Prerequisite: (CSE 331) and (STT 351 or STT 380 or STT 430 or STT 441) and MTH 314 and (MTH 234 or MTH 254H or LB 220)
description.Restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Data Science Major.
description.Description: Principles and techniques for large-scale data analysis and applications.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 3 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Computer Science Major. Approval of department; application required.
description.Description: Supervised individual study in an area of computer science.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 9 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Computer Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major or in the Computer Science Disciplinary Teaching Minor. Approval of department.
description.Description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses and lead to the development of new courses.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 12 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Approval of department.

description.Description: Topics selected to supplement and enrich existing courses in Data Science.
description.Interdepartmental With: Computational Mathematics, Science, & Engineering, Statistics and Probability
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
description.Credits: Total Credits: 4   Lecture/Recitation/Discussion Hours: 2   Lab Hours: 4
description.Prerequisite: (CSE 232 and CMSE 382) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

description.Restrictions: Open to seniors.
description.Description: Team-based data science projects working with real-world data in collaboration with client/company sponsors. Practice in software development, data collection, curation, modeling, scientific visualization and presentation of results. Students may be required to sign a non-disclosure agreement (“NDA”) or an assignment of intellectual property rights (“IP Assignment”) to work with some project sponsors.
description.Interdepartmental With: Computational Mathematics, Science, & Engineering, Statistics and Probability
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

description.Credits: Total Credits: 4   Lecture/Recitation/Discussion Hours: 2   Lab Hours: 4
description.Prerequisite: (CSE 402 or CSE 415 or CSE 422 or CSE 431 or CSE 440 or CSE 450 or CSE 471 or CSE 476 or CSE 477 or CSE 482) and (CSE 402 or CSE 420 or CSE 425 or CSE 435 or CSE 440 or CSE 460 or CSE 472 or CSE 477 or CSE 480 or CSE 482) and ((CSE 300 and CSE 325 and CSE 335) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)
description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Computer Science Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major.
description.Description: Development of a comprehensive software and/or hardware solution to a problem in a team setting with emphasis on working with a client. Participation in a design cycle including specification, design, implementation, testing, maintenance, and documentation. Issues of professionalism, ethics, and communication. Students may be asked to sign a non-disclosure agreement (“NDA”) or an assignment of intellectual property rights (“IP Assignment”) to work with some project sponsors.

description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 3 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Computer Engineering Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Coordinate Major or in the Lyman Briggs Computer Science Major. Approval of department.
description.Description: Independent undergraduate research in contemporary areas of computer science.

description.Recommended Background: Probability, some linear algebra, and some geometry. Some programming background such as familiarity with python and scripting/command line usage in various operating systems.
description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Business Analytics Major.
description.Description: Introduction to data retrieval, processing, analysis, and visualization.

description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Business Analytics Major.
description.Description: Basic techniques and algorithms for knowledge discovery in databases.

description.Recommended Background: (CSE 331 and MTH 314 and STT 441) or CSE 331 and MTH 314 and STT 441
description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Introduction to salient topics in statistical pattern recognition. These include concepts in Bayesian decision theory, parametric and non-parametric density estimation schemes, linear discriminant functions, perceptrons and unsupervised clustering. The project component of this course will test the student's ability to design and evaluate classifiers on datasets.

description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Visual information processing problems. Human and machine vision systems. Image formation and transforms. Encoding, enhancement, edge detection, segmentation. 2D and 3D object description and recognition. Scene analysis. Applications.

description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Electrical Engineering Major or in the Computer Science Major.
description.Description: Principles, paradigms, techniques used in distributed systems. Assurance techniques for distributed systems. Fault-tolerance and security issues in distributed systems. Research issues in the design and implementation of distributed systems.

Advanced topics in digital integrated circuit design. Design specifications: functionality, performance, reliability, manufacturability, testability, cost. Standard cells. Design-rule checking. Circuit extraction, simulation, verification. Team-based design.

description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.

description.Description: Formal specification languages, integrating verification with development. Design and the implementation of term project.

description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering.
description.Description: Advanced concepts in the organization and architecture of modern computer systems.

description.Recommended Background: Calculus at the level of MTH 133. Ability to program proficiently in C/C++, basic understanding of data structures and algorithms (both at the level of CSE 232). Basic linear algebra and differential equations.
description.Description: Core principles, techniques, and use of parallel computation using modern supercomputers. Parallel architectures. Parallel programming models. Principles of parallel algorithm design. Performance analysis and optimization.

description.Restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.
description.Description: Advanced topics in emerging computer networking technologies, including high-speed wide area networks and local area networks, wireless and mobile computing networks, optical networks, and multimedia networking.
Threat assessments, secure software, intrusions and intrusion detection.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
description.Restrictions: Open only to majors in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Analysis of algorithms. Algorithm design techniques. Efficient algorithms for classical problems. Intractable problems and techniques to handle them.

description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Classical concepts in Graph Theory. Algorithmic aspects of graphs such as finding paths, network flow, spanning trees and matching.

description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Conduct research in machine learning, artificial intelligence, deep learning, data mining, and other related fields.

description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.
description.Description: Types of intelligence, knowledge representation, cognitive models. Goal-based systems, heuristic search and games, expert systems. Language understanding, robotics and computer vision, theorem proving and deductive systems, and learning.

description.Recommended Background: Programming skills, basic probability and statistics knowledge.

description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Techniques for engaging in multi-disciplinary research collaborations, including biology, computer science, and engineering. Students engage in group projects to answer fundamental questions about the dynamics of actively evolving systems including both natural and computational. Multi-disciplinary teams will learn to overcome discipline-specific language and conceptual issues. Experimental design, statistical analysis, data visualization, and paper and grant writing for multi-disciplinary audiences.

description.Interdepartmental With: Microbiology and Molecular Genetics, Integrative Biology

description.Recommended Background: Algorithms, programming in C or equivalent, probability and statistics, artificial intelligence.
description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Computational study of learning and data mining. Strengths and limitations of various learning paradigms, including supervised learning, learning from scalar reward, unsupervised learning, and learning with domain knowledge.

description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering and open to graduate students in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Investigation of evolutionary computation from a historical, theoretical and application viewpoint. Readings from the present literature, experiments with provided software on the application of evolutionary computation principles.

description.Recommended Background: MTH 314 and STT 441 or equivalent CSE 841 or 842 or 847
description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Overview of both the foundational ideas and the recent advances in deep neural network algorithms and applications.

description.Restrictions: Open only to majors in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.
description.Description: Models of computation: partial recursive functions, Turing machines, alternative models of computing. Basic theory and limitations of computability. Undecidability. Resource-bounded computational complexity, non-determinism, NP-completeness.

description.Recommended Background: Undergraduate course work in behavioral biology, cognitive psychology, philosophy, linguistics, or artificial intelligence.
description.Description: Survey of how different disciplines explore the cognitive processes underlying intelligent behavior.

description.Restrictions: Open only to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering.

description.Description: Methods and techniques supporting later lifecycle activities, including software testing and maintenance, reuse, and reverse engineering. Domain-specific software engineering methods. Human-computer interfaces, distributed systems, and visualization techniques.
description.Recommended Background: Programming skills in C, C++, Java and Matlab. Basic knowledge in calculus, probability and statistics.
description.Restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering or approval of department.

description.Description: Overview of neuro-engineering technology. Basic neural network architectures. Feedforward and feedback networks. Temporal modeling. Supervised and unsupervised learning. Implementation. Basic applications to pattern recognition.

description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 6 credits in all enrollments for this course.

description.Restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors. Approval of department.
description.Description: Independent study of some topic, system, or language not covered in a regular course.
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 9 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Open only to Computer Science or Electrical Engineering majors.
description.Description: Selected topics in computer science of current interest and importance but not covered in a regular course.

description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 3 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Approval of department.
description.Description: Exploring research in computer science under faculty supervision, including but not limited to attending research group meetings, assisting faculty with a specific research project, and/or reading research literature.

description.Reenrollment Information: A student may earn a maximum of 24 credits in all enrollments for this course.
description.Restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering. Approval of department.
description.Description: In depth student project where the student performs original research, research replication, or survey and reporting on a topic such as system design and development, or system conversion or installation.
description.Semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

description.Restrictions: Open only to Computer Science majors. Approval of department.
description.Description: Master's thesis research.
